variants.Description in input context: This variant causes a missense change and destabilizes the PINK1 protein.
This variant leads to premature stop codon.

Material used.Material Name: Fibroblasts from patients with Hereditary Myopathy
Material used.Description: Fibroblasts were cultured and treated as described previously (Smith et al., 1998).

Readout description.Result Description: The levels of PINK1 protein were significantly reduced in patient-derived fibroblasts carrying NM_004931.5:c.1220G>A. Western blot analysis revealed a reduction of 75% compared to controls.
The levels of PINK1 protein were completely absent in patient-derived fibroblasts carrying NM_004931.5:c.1617A>T. Western blot analysis revealed no detectable protein signal compared to controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Each experiment was performed with fibroblasts from three separate patients.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate on a single blot.

Basic positive control.Description: Fibroblasts from healthy donors were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Fibroblasts treated with a proteasome inhibitor (MG132) were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used to compare protein levels between patient-derived fibroblasts and controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression between 80% and 120% of the mean for healthy donor fibroblasts.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression below 80% or above 120% of the mean for healthy donor fibroblasts.
